headline: Can Howmet Sustain Growth as Defense Aerospace Demand Surges?
summary: HWM's defense aerospace strength, fueled by F-35 engine parts demand and new contracts, is propelling robust revenue growth.

headline: General Dynamics' Q3 Earnings Surpass Estimates, Revenues Improve Y/Y
summary: GD posts strong Q3 results with EPS up 15.8% and revenues climbing 10.6%, fueled by Aerospace and Marine Systems growth.

raw.headline: General Dynamics' Q3 Earnings Surpass Estimates, Revenues Improve Y/Y

headline: Morning Movers: Tesla, IBM slipping following quarterly reports
summary: Stock futures were modestly lower as disappointing quarterly results from major tech names weighed on sentiment. Markets look set to open with a muted tone, reflecting a mix of elevated risk and uncertainty. Oil surged nearly 4% after the U.S. imposed fresh sanctions on Russia’s top oil companies, creating a shockwave across energy markets and raising inflation concerns. Concurrently, the dollar firmed against major currencies ahead of a delayed U.S. consumer-price report, while the yen weakened

headline: Textron (TXT) Net Profit Margin Declines to 5.8%, Testing Bullish Valuation Narrative
summary: Textron (TXT) reported forecast earnings growth of 6.4% per year and revenue growth of 3.2% per year, both trailing the broader US market's expected growth rates of 15.5% and 10% respectively. Over the past five years, Textron’s earnings have posted an average annual growth of 12.9%, with the latest figures showing the net profit margin slipping to 5.8% from 6.7% a year ago. The combination of consistent historic earnings and a share price of $79.47, trading below the estimated fair value of...

headline: TXT Q3 Deep Dive: CEO Transition and Defense Demand Shape Outlook
summary: Aerospace and defense company Textron (NYSE:TXT) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales rose 5.1% year on year to $3.60 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.55 per share was 6.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
